canonical_explanation.text: A pattern is something that repeats in a regular way. We see patterns in shapes, colours, sizes, and numbers. An AB pattern repeats two things: for example, red-blue-red-blue. An ABC pattern repeats three things: for example, circle-square-triangle-circle-square-triangle. To find what comes next, look at what is repeating and continue the pattern.
rules: A pattern is a sequence that repeats.
An AB pattern has 2 items repeating: A, B, A, B, A, B ...
An ABC pattern has 3 items repeating: A, B, C, A, B, C ...
To find what comes next, identify what is repeating.
Patterns can use shapes, colours, sizes, or numbers.

questions.explanation_correct: The pattern is red-blue repeating. After red comes blue.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is an AB pattern: red, blue, red, blue, red, blue. After red comes blue.

questions.explanation_correct: The pattern is star-moon repeating. After star comes moon.
questions.explanation_incorrect: AB pattern: star, moon, star, moon, star, moon. The next is moon.

questions.question_text: What type of pattern is this? ğŸ”´ğŸ”µğŸ”´ğŸ”µğŸ”´ğŸ”µ
questions.explanation_correct: This is an AB pattern. Two items (red, blue) repeat over and over.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Red and blue alternate: A = red, B = blue. This is an AB pattern.

questions.explanation_correct: The pattern is triangle-circle repeating. After triangle comes circle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: AB pattern: triangle, circle, triangle, circle, triangle, circle.

questions.explanation_correct: The pattern is red-blue-green repeating (ABC). After red comes blue.
questions.explanation_incorrect: ABC pattern: red, blue, green, red, blue, green, red, blue. After red comes blue.

questions.explanation_correct: The ABC pattern is star-moon-sun. After moon comes sun.
questions.explanation_incorrect: ABC pattern: star, moon, sun, star, moon, sun, star, moon, sun.

questions.explanation_correct: The pattern is big-small repeating. After big comes small.
questions.explanation_incorrect: AB pattern: big, small, big, small, big, small.

questions.explanation_correct: The pattern is clap-stomp repeating. After clap comes stomp.
questions.explanation_incorrect: AB pattern: clap, stomp, clap, stomp, clap, stomp.

questions.question_text: Priya is making a bead necklace: red-yellow-red-yellow-red-yellow. What colour bead should she add next?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern is red-yellow repeating. After yellow, the next is red.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Red, yellow, red, yellow, red, yellow, red. The pattern continues with red.

questions.explanation_correct: The numbers go up by 1 each time: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is a counting pattern: add 1 each time. After 5 comes 6.

questions.explanation_correct: The numbers go up by 2 each time: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Counting by 2s: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10. The next number is 10.

questions.explanation_correct: The numbers go up by 1: 5, 6, 7, 8, 9.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Counting by 1: 5, 6, 7, 8, 9. The next number is 9.

questions.explanation_correct: The numbers go up by 2 (odd numbers): 1, 3, 5, 7, 9.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Add 2 each time: 1, 3, 5, 7, 9. The next number is 9.

questions.explanation_correct: True. Red-blue repeats over and over. This is an AB pattern.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. The same sequence (red, blue) repeats, making it a pattern.

questions.explanation_correct: False. These are 5 different items with no repetition shown. A pattern must repeat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. A pattern must have a repeating part. These 5 items do not repeat.

questions.question_text: Aarav is building with blocks: tall-short-tall-short. What block comes next?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern is tall-short repeating. After short comes tall.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tall, short, tall, short, tall. After short, the next is tall.

questions.question_text: Kavya wants to make an ABC pattern using shapes. Which should she use?
questions.explanation_correct: Circle-square-triangle repeating is an ABC pattern with 3 different shapes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An ABC pattern has 3 items repeating: A (circle), B (square), C (triangle).

questions.explanation_correct: The pattern is flower1-flower2 repeating. The missing one is flower2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: AB pattern: ğŸŒ¸ğŸŒºğŸŒ¸ğŸŒºğŸŒ¸ğŸŒºğŸŒ¸. The missing item is ğŸŒº.

questions.explanation_correct: Each number is 10 more than the last. The pattern is adding 10.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 10, 20, 30, 40, 50 â€” each time we add 10.

questions.question_text: Diya drew: circle-square-circle-square-circle. What should she draw next?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern is circle-square repeating. After circle comes square.
questions.explanation_incorrect: AB pattern: circle, square, circle, square, circle, square.

questions.explanation_correct: The ABC pattern is red-blue-green. The missing one starts the next cycle: red.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Red, blue, green repeating. The blank starts a new cycle, so it is red.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a pattern?

options.text: A, B, A, B, A, B

questions.explanation_correct: A, B, A, B, A, B is a repeating AB pattern.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A, B, A, B, A, B repeats the same two items. The others do not repeat.

questions.explanation_correct: Counting by 1: 3, 4, 5, 6, 7. The next number is 7.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Add 1 each time: 3, 4, 5, 6, 7.

questions.question_text: Rohan is making a rangoli with colours: orange-green-orange-green. What comes after the 6th colour?
questions.explanation_correct: AB pattern: orange(1), green(2), orange(3), green(4), orange(5), green(6), orange(7). The 7th is orange.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pattern alternates. Position 7 = orange (odd positions are orange).

questions.question_text: Neha wants to create a pattern using 3 things. Which is an ABC pattern?

options.text: Red, blue, green, red, blue, green

questions.explanation_correct: Red-blue-green repeating is an ABC pattern with 3 different items.
questions.explanation_incorrect: ABC pattern uses 3 items: A (red), B (blue), C (green), then repeats.

questions.explanation_correct: Counting by 2s: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10. The missing number is 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pattern is +2 each time: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10.

questions.question_text: What is the repeating unit in this pattern? ğŸŒ¸ğŸŒºğŸŒ¸ğŸŒºğŸŒ¸ğŸŒº
questions.explanation_correct: The repeating unit is ğŸŒ¸ğŸŒº â€” these two repeat over and over.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The smallest group that repeats is flower1 + flower2. This pair repeats.

questions.explanation_correct: The pattern is up-down repeating. After up comes down.
questions.explanation_incorrect: AB pattern: up, down, up, down, up, down.

questions.explanation_correct: Each number is 5 more than the last. The rule is add 5.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 5, 10, 15, 20, 25 â€” each time we add 5.

questions.question_text: Kabir made a pattern: ğŸ”ºğŸ”µâ­ğŸ”ºğŸ”µâ­ğŸ”ºğŸ”µ. What comes next?
questions.explanation_correct: The ABC pattern is triangle-circle-star. After circle comes star.
questions.explanation_incorrect: ğŸ”ºğŸ”µâ­ repeats. After ğŸ”µ comes â­.

questions.explanation_correct: The pattern is happy-sad repeating. After happy comes sad.
questions.explanation_incorrect: AB pattern: happy, sad, happy, sad, happy, sad.

questions.explanation_correct: Counting by 1: 7, 8, 9, 10.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Add 1 each time: 7, 8, 9, 10.

questions.question_text: Siya is threading beads: pink-white-pink-white. She has 8 beads so far. What colour is the 9th bead?
questions.explanation_correct: Pink is at positions 1, 3, 5, 7, 9 (odd). The 9th bead is pink.
questions.explanation_incorrect: AB pattern: pink(1), white(2), pink(3), white(4)... 9 is odd, so it is pink.

questions.explanation_correct: True. Triangle and square alternate â€” this is an AB pattern.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Two shapes alternate: triangle (A), square (B), repeating.

questions.explanation_correct: Apple-banana-orange repeating is an ABC pattern (3 items).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Three items repeat: A (apple), B (banana), C (orange). This is ABC.

questions.explanation_correct: Counting backward by 1: 10, 9, 8, 7, 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Subtract 1 each time: 10, 9, 8, 7, 6.

questions.question_text: Complete the pattern: red, blue, ____, blue, red, blue
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern is red-blue repeating. The blank is red.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Red, blue, red, blue, red, blue. The missing one is red.

questions.question_text: Which does NOT follow the AB pattern?
questions.explanation_correct: ğŸ”´ğŸ”µğŸŸ¢ğŸ”´ğŸ”µğŸŸ¢ is an ABC pattern (3 items), not AB (2 items).
questions.explanation_incorrect: AB patterns have 2 items repeating. The third option has 3 items (ABC pattern).

questions.explanation_correct: Counting by 1: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6. The missing number is 4.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The numbers go up by 1. After 3 comes 4.

questions.question_text: Meera made an ABC pattern with shapes. Which could it be?

options.text: Circle, square, triangle, circle, square, triangle

questions.explanation_correct: Circle-square-triangle repeating uses 3 shapes â€” that is an ABC pattern.
questions.explanation_incorrect: ABC needs 3 different items repeating. C has circle (A), square (B), triangle (C).

questions.explanation_correct: Green-yellow repeating. After green comes yellow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: AB pattern: green, yellow, green, yellow, green, yellow.

questions.explanation_correct: Add 2 each time: 4, 6, 8, 10, 12.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Counting by 2: 4, 6, 8, 10, 12. The next is 12.

questions.question_text: In an AB pattern, two things repeat.
questions.explanation_correct: True. An AB pattern has exactly 2 items that keep repeating.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. AB means 2 items: A and B, repeating.

questions.question_text: ABC pattern: cat, dog, bird, cat, dog, ____
questions.explanation_correct: The ABC pattern is cat-dog-bird. After dog comes bird.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cat (A), dog (B), bird (C) repeating. After dog comes bird.

questions.question_text: Arjun is arranging tiles: square-circle-square-circle. He has placed 10 tiles. What is the 11th tile?
questions.explanation_correct: Odd positions are square, even positions are circle. 11 is odd, so square.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Square(1), circle(2), square(3), circle(4)... 11 is odd = square.

questions.explanation_correct: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 follows a rule (add 1). It is a number pattern.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 goes up by 1 each time. This is a clear number pattern.

questions.question_text: What is the pattern in: day-night-day-night-day-night?
questions.explanation_correct: Day and night alternate â€” this is an AB pattern.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Two items (day, night) alternate. A = day, B = night. AB pattern.

questions.explanation_correct: The ABC pattern is red-blue-green. The missing starts a new cycle: red.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Red, blue, green, red, blue, green, red, blue, green. The 4th item is red.

questions.explanation_correct: Counting down by 2: 20, 18, 16, 14, 12.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Subtract 2 each time: 20, 18, 16, 14, 12.

questions.question_text: Ananya drew: â­ğŸ”ºâ­ğŸ”ºâ­ğŸ”ºâ­ğŸ”º. How many stars are there?
questions.explanation_correct: In the AB pattern, stars are at positions 1, 3, 5, 7. That is 4 stars.
questions.explanation_incorrect: â­ğŸ”ºâ­ğŸ”ºâ­ğŸ”ºâ­ğŸ”º has 4 stars and 4 triangles, total 8 shapes.
